jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

F846804FE8504FC48C3CBFE39BE8BD3B.description:
Share their response to Scripture or Sunday readings as an
integral part of their lifelong faith formation.

6BBA68F0E2194BADA151326454B5F674.description: Attend Mass and discuss Sunday readings.

230D007184B24DDF8BBF41752DB82C86.description: Read or tell Bible Stories together as a family.

EEAC131325A94DDD951DC588F1094DF6.description: Standard D: Experience communal Scripture study and sharing as a basis for lifelong faith formation. -Life Application

E82AA951385C47BD9E8503CC2AA62DA2.description:
Share Scripture Stories as a group through drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

CA29FF2D1A7D449180F789F36EAF2217.description:
Compare the values in Scripture to the Church’s teachings
on social justice as a basis of their lifelong journey in faith.

417D6B36F1A449D88E0D298B2F0EEDBD.description:
Discuss the value of studying Scripture with others as a
means to enrich their faith lives (Matthew 18:20 – “ For
where two or three are gathered together in My name, there
I am in the midst of them.”)

BF6CDEEDB0374E4BB4F6AE20E5E17CBC.description: Connect Scripture to their own life experiences.

E97775F5FF704292B56EA9027285E58A.description:
Discuss the Sunday readings and when appropriate discuss
the Homily.

E96FE52AE260408184BF026D26813402.description: Standard D: Experience communal Scripture study and sharing as a basis for lifelong faith formation. -Skill

2061F6795AAB494D8F3647B00A4DD167.description:
Know that Scripture can be used whenever we pray
together.

A3D8267D4A7A405AADEF3E25269D405F.description:
Know that the Homily is one way to share the meaning of
Scripture.

D27810A218BE42B3926F6CC87E312633.description:
Know that studying and sharing Scripture with others is
helpful to faith development.

C391D9DB15EE45FC98C137BA1E4F42E7.description: Standard D: Experience communal Scripture study and sharing as a basis for lifelong faith formation. -Knowledge

DA6803D8EC2248FB8687F228455F5B2B.description: GOAL 4- Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of Scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

9AE54CCE175346C486C72A92F0A4A401.description: Read the Bible and use it in prayer.

96FC6E12822547D0BB174744022E37C6.description: Standard C: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer. -Life Application

31D1143972B94760B3DF0C84DA93220F.description:
Illustrate how Scripture is a part of personal prayer through
drama, art, music, technology, etc.

3FB85897B4C949B7B0A03FB5F59BC7B3.description:
Identify approaches to Scripture that are not in accordance
with Catholic interpretation, e.g. fundamentalism.

55EC502EAF7746DDB250501D75612394.description:
Explore resources for prayer and Scripture, such as books,
recordings, Internet, etc.

EA9DAB489F8D48F18D2A8E35FC3AD7E6.description:
Appreciate the context of a particular Scripture Story
within the whole of Scripture.

41EF628B6D5A4971B46CA2E88533A919.description:
Select passages in the Old and New Testament and apply it
to their lives or events in the world.

52A1F591AABA41B4BC43115CAF3B5289.description:
Pray together using Scripture and/or readings from
Lectionary.

7907E4E3B9F34D3F9DB28B7F6F0E7B92.description: Compare how Jesus prayed with how we pray today.

97F8B653716041D4933A78AA8D12AD93.description:
Study Scripture to help them grow in their personal
relationship with God.

AABBB448E2AE47E1A85D4608C5B63FB5.description: Standard C: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer. -Skill

DD44203E5F71474785EE8763AB63E906.description: Understand how Catholics interpret the Bible.

DD4A773747AC4997B9C3023D606D0B79.description:
Know Scripture can be used in personal prayer, e.g. Guided
Meditation, Lectio Divina, Praying the Psalms, etc.

5E4CA4E3A3934914940DD6EA3E1D5DF8.description:
Know Bible has two parts, The Old Testament (Jewish
Scripture) and The New Testament (Christian) and is a
library of different kinds of literature (history, poetry,
prophecy, etc).

29423F1FB3F441B8B465E06FA780F249.description:
Know that the Bible is a primary source of revelation about
the nature of God.

1D7561CAB5B4493889B14C87E5A5F06A.description: Know that the Bible is the story of salvation history

35834748A95E4729A321F9789E89604D.description: Standard C: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer. -Knowledge

0461F4C137D3445AA2373254817FC721.description: GOAL 4- Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

C5F20949EBB444528EE9FE0726100CC4.description: Standard B: Experience the importance of prayer and appreciate a variety of prayer types and traditions. -Life Application

D8BD158FA6AD458DB3676B0433D7A978.description:
Illustrate the experience of prayer through drama, art, music,
technology, etc.

776167176FC04E62A2056D529D536AB3.description: Utilize prayer partners within school, parish, or community.

F701FA871BF24CDE853A1B396C07C152.description:
Research the different traditions Catholic Christian Spirituality
e.g. Benedictine (St. Benedict), Ignatian (St. Ignatius of
Loyola), Franciscan (St. Francis), Carmelite (St. Theresa of
Avila, St. John of the Cross, St. Theresa of Lisieux).

E9CDDCA459C64BA4B90EDE4F21BB5CE8.description:
Explain the structure and the significance of The Lord’s Prayer
(CCC 2803 ff).

9B380DD1CA244BD788C9C594AFE482F9.description: Research the history and the origin of traditional prayers.

B41FA34431BD42D286F65F85DCA92FC4.description:
Know and recite the following prayers: The Lord’s Prayer,
The Hail Mary, Glory Be, Act of Contrition, Nicene Creed,
Apostles Creed, Rosary.

72EE471684F64EAD9E5F7EED9FB0340B.description: Participate in Mass, in prayers and in responses.

F68DE3DDD6E2493A81DBE48D3DA5BA84.description:
Experience the different forms of prayer through a variety of
prayer celebrations.

B9639FBC825448D484B64F3ADCAE555B.description: Standard B: Experience the importance of prayer and appreciate a variety of prayer types and traditions. -Skill

D21B8CB31AEC4E44A85764B4240043A5.description:
Know that there are different traditions of Catholic Christian
Spirituality, e.g. Benedictine, (St. Benedict), Ignatian (St.
Ignatius of Loyola), Franciscan (St. Francis), Carmelite (St.
Theresa of Avila, St. John of the Cross, St. Theresa of
Lisieux), etc.

EDF26C5752B64ACDA77BA1DE45D69B2B.description:
Know that Faith Formation (Religion class) is not just another
academic subject, but is a lifelong journey.

DA61A161ABBF4059A5F3D5F2B3D5C5A8.description:
Know that The Lord’s Prayer is the model prayer given to us
by Jesus.

8E6130C12CF341DDBFC2A44FE9107F53.description:
Know the importance of devotional prayer such as Seasonal
Customs (Advent Wreath, Way of the Cross), Litanies,
Rosary/Marian Devotions), etc.

E702BB6AD8DF45B6B6CC526191316EBE.description:
Know the importance of liturgical prayer such as Mass and
Liturgy of the Hours (morning and evening prayers).

5D9B9C59BBEA4BD4A6C9520966656A5A.description:
Know that the three major expressions of prayer are vocal
prayer, meditation, and contemplative prayer.

573E60C37BFB4C9180B1EE939C5A1699.description: Standard B: Experience the importance of prayer and appreciate a variety of prayer types and traditions. -Knowledge

79EB8B6091374FC586A4237996E14042.description: GOAL 4- Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

543B91AE8797450CA66B5DEBB0AFD0F3.description:
Pray with family. (“Christian family is first place for
education and prayer”. CCC #2694).

0407F5A6998A48EBA94516FF4E48DBAB.description: Make prayer a part of their daily life.

9775116784FD4D6EB2533A474449D2BF.description: Standard A: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God. -Life Application

4811DEE78D1B4AB7B00DFC6CFBF99AAD.description:
Illustrate expressions of prayer through drama, art, music,
technology, etc.

43D90A149ED24983BF18DEBDD299AEDE.description: Share their experience with prayer, i.e. “give witness.”

5E87B3A4429C4C08BCF2656FD8A95F31.description:
Discuss ways in which their relationships with others reflect
their relationship with God.

38C26268294741F9A4B4965E3968C839.description: Further develop ways of entering into prayer by praying.

BA4A4FF442714B7D89F1E43A9B738010.description: Standard A: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God. -Skill

EDF20359C67C4E98AB42490127563439.description: Know there are many ways to pray.

5191818F00694DE6BCBCECCA046054D2.description:
Know basic forms of prayer are blessing, intercession,
thanksgiving and praise.

F390F32E296E4C799BDFFC37078000E4.description:
Know that prayer is the raising of their minds and hearts to
God.

AE39155EB0C545F59DEABB338C9DD104.description:
Know that prayer (their relationship with God) has the power
to change their lives.

D83487D6D9BC4CEAA6EA80F4A0CA753C.description:
Know that prayer is a lifelong relationship with God that
requires nurturing.

3BD9734B17294E4893FDAA3371E900BD.description: Know God calls each person to encounter God in prayer.

E25FD89EEA5B43EFB33F0B42A473B33F.description: Standard A: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God. -Knowledge

F8A87B3847994C0EA827BB87D1B8D36E.description: GOAL 4- Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

70DC659A15C748C09A14E382ADE6E1E2.description:
Demonstrate a Christian life through stewardship and
through service.

F844350C55AD49F29D3D8A519AC9EE3A.description: Explain Catholic teachings to peers and to adults.

C7A9AF5342C84804AA684A84C7CD601D.description:
Standard D: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world,
and evangelizers for Christ. -Life Application

9D2DA4E170664027BB4B9B9F144F02D7.description:
Illustrate stewardship and evangelization through drama,
art, music, technology, etc.

00474ECC1C44482D9C3E05D3415F30FE.description:
Identify the scriptural basis for stewardship and for
evangelization.

88644B9825E047C48EB7AAA4B1559FCB.description: Identify stewardship of time, talent, and treasure.

BEA5B14ED4C14CA19D634AD0F213A731.description: Participate in experiences of environmental stewardship.

E312DDDA8DE941AFAB7DBFE9B59114F6.description:
Respect property and environment at school, at home, in
the parish and in the community.

161E388361234914B3689DA27FD5EEC4.description:
Describe how we can take care of God’s World, e.g.
people, animals, nature, etc.

9D3629D2079D4AF189AD020451FD3B7E.description:
Identify and discuss the Precepts of the Church and apply
them to their lives.

0E2DC23842CC425C9EC4F600BA61F385.description: Share faith with others through word and deed.

949CE37F87CA4919A8759ED93E7814D3.description:
Standard D: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world,
and evangelizers for Christ. -Skill

E8EDA49F29B9424EAC06E2EAF83F11EA.description:
Know that “sending forth” from the liturgy calls us to love
and to serve the world.

63A526256BC742AC8E4E4BD967B9C00D.description:
Know that our faith calls us to share the Good News
of Christ.

2F7CA9AADA664D8EB42E400C84E5BD5C.description:
Learn about stewardship of God’s World, e.g. respect for
life, needs vs. wants, recycling, etc..

AFB8565BCD5E461481456ACE4395608F.description:
Know the responsibilities of being a member of the
Catholic Church, e.g. Precepts of the Church.

13301DD607784CBBA84E6682C76A51AA.description:
Understand that there are different Rites and Churches
(Catholic Source Book).

9BBA4DC3E59948DA8CFB8341789DBB47.description:
Understand that we are members of the universal
(worldwide) church under the guidance of the Holy Spirit
and of the Church’s leaders.

232B570487754296B07E2F029D53D8E0.description:
Standard D: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world,
and evangelizers for Christ. -Knowledge

83B16810393F4DC6BA19FF610BBD3045.description: GOAL 3- Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ.

7B7F79AAE6ED443C9BCD3AC9CDA143B3.description: Be aware of God’s Grace in their lives and respond to it.

AEBF6418E5514AA3843E7276216CEF52.description: Standard C: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life. -Life Application

3CE4D004BFF04EB3A1565ACC7CF3CBBA.description:
Illustrate God’s Friendship and Blessings using drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

FB9BA1A621394212A9D2B7CCF5D729A6.description:
Connect their personal experiences of love, compassion
and overcoming adversity with Christ’s Paschal Mystery.

EA394B078E7241F5A108653771FF64BF.description:
Identify and share stories of their personal experiences of
God’s Grace.

037A0544D096470BAF70CD20C0BC92A2.description:
Explain how their interaction with others is a reflection of
God’s Grace within them.

ADF363F45EC045549208FF5D95DAEA2C.description:
Identify other people as an extension of Christ by their
works, e.g. through sharing of gifts, talents, ministries, etc.

79C8D6B592784D65B881E953326B9181.description: Standard C: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life. -Skill

C44F63D99B2F4382901A23BC99B0029E.description:
Recognize the connection between Christ’s Passion and
Resurrection and the Paschal Mystery in their lives
(personal challenges).

126E8584EC2C4F0BA5E4A2948F8270E1.description:
Know that prayer and the sacraments are channels of God’s
Grace.

C5B2806386984193902F3F32A94E8944.description:
Know that the Holy Spirit, through the gift of God’s Grace,
justifies us and cleanses us from sin through faith and
through baptism (CCC 1987-9).

863327F2C5D34218A5506B439EAB4E4F.description: Know that “grace” is participation in the life of God.

A338D63A489E4F2692FEEE7DF2F0D78C.description:
Know that “sanctifying grace” is a gift freely given by God
to help us respond to the call to become God’s Children.

47CB2B5793304353B3A40C49A38B4A4F.description: Standard C: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life. -Knowledge

34016A276DEA48299E60296DEC71DED0.description: GOAL 3- Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ

C0A35CE032174D929883A9FB5C0CAFFD.description:
Perform acts of service for family, for Church and for
community.

BF67493540B44CD79E54BC3F5209DFBF.description:
Reflect the love of Christ by loving, by caring and by
accepting others.

857448F044F145A0A91ED655382BB18E.description: Standard B: Know and understand the principles of Catholic Social Justice Teaching and experience how to apply them appropriately through a life of service. -Life Application

1105769D3A5847EABC533D88296D64FB.description:
Illustrate an understanding of helpfulness and a respect for
diversity using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

5E0B1172E4BB4D81AF127E2A4BF16A56.description: Give examples of cultural diversity and its benefits.

5B1B0ECF4714470184B74A68B3D32196.description: Plan a service project with class.

3A922278AB8241F4961A5731DE09E59E.description:
Give contemporary examples of the corporal and of the
spiritual Works of Mercy.

E3711AE3DA6A44F789A3DDCF79AEBD9B.description: Discuss ways to consciously help others.

29361B0F35C747329BBB71DBC1BC1C36.description:
Identify contemporary people who have modeled service
and social justice.

7E708445DB894BC7BF4D2FEED05C1B7F.description: Explore the lives of the saints as models of discipleship.

5E5B66FAB1B240DC882C94F46A130AAB.description:
Explain how the life of Christ is a life of service and of
justice.

019C6B03AE304BA6B1BABA234DA85130.description: Standard B: Know and understand the principles of Catholic Social Justice Teaching and experience how to apply them appropriately through a life of service. -Skill

1B04CABF012A489FA44570D0EDFC2254.description:
Understand the importance of helping others through the
corporal and spiritual Works of Mercy.

37BE02463B854A458C8158BC77A4E3DF.description:
Understand social justice and know that it is obtained by
respecting the rights and the dignity of others.

5130E7D0DDC3411799419E5CA0755588.description:
Know the meaning of Jesus’ law of love: Love one another
as I have loved you.

9E0C85471E904D138908CDF3B7667EB1.description:
Know that even though people are different, all are created
in God’s image.

AAC83A489795465CB7B2A8AB8CE28EAC.description: Recognize that all people are God’s Children.

154F6830BEC04E09BA92479D9B5F8C57.description: Standard B: Know and understand the principles of Catholic Social Justice Teaching and experience how to apply them appropriately through a life of service. -Knowledge

9A2DBC9F3B0E4CC693CCB0F9EA485142.description: GOAL 3- Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ

B34D82D419744651A35A0345CC743FB5.description:
Incorporate the virtues (faith, hope, charity, prudence, justice,
fortitude and temperance) into their lives.

5E73CC9C87E1470082F953F7B83288BB.description:
Be able to make good moral decisions based on Beatitudes,
Ten Commandments, and Church Teachings.

D0D5C6F09F8C461AB448F0F2F5207667.description: Develop a right relationship with God, others and self.

555A2CEE4BB7415DA09ED2D1C71EFCD1.description: Standard A: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience. -Life Application

B5CDC6755AC1446E95657B7ED1B77C21.description:
Illustrate examples of living the Beatitudes, the Ten
Commandments, and the virtues using drama, art, music,
technology, etc.

9093F2B2FDFD42F89D1BED78C24E833A.description:
Examine their conscience using Beatitudes and Ten
Commandments.

E7373FC94BCD4F98A5355587E20C618C.description:
Read and discuss Scripture Stories related to the Beatitudes
and to the Ten Commandments.

373B7B57655D4B2FB9C53F07F5B2AEDE.description: Compare and contrast the Commandments and the Beatitudes.

E9D9858E99D24A5CBA9E22B36EBE90F2.description:
Interpret and apply each of the Beatitudes and each of the Ten
Commandments to contemporary life situations.

1103126C7D16440EB4E73EF3DF8BA791.description: Standard A: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience. -Skill

ABD0D36BC8674D88AC26AC5E8458B156.description: Know and understand the theme of covenant in Scripture.

EA6478860972494487798EC90C338E03.description:
Understand the nature of sin and the need to seek God’s
forgiveness through the sacrament of Reconciliation.

65611AF2B0D6493CAA61E36C1E2CFCC5.description:
Understand that they have free will and are able to make
informed choices.

41D9E77B8CDF4FCB8A96F2D2D711AB46.description: Know the three Theological and four Cardinal Virtues.

E463ECBE2B854E0FB5228DE526967617.description:
Know that virtues are habitual and are firm dispositions to do
good.

A83FFA3A19574782AD8EF59D7A380D42.description: Know that it is God’s will that we live a good, moral life.

60492CF954AC4DD4AD161BDB2C0C3F97.description:
Know the Ten Commandments and know how they apply to
daily life.

BF15A4115ECC4DD2AE59CA846460D310.description:
Know that the Beatitudes are God’s way of drawing us to him
so we can be happy and spiritually fulfilled,

5134A42CC3724549BD85834E44C74CD0.description: Standard A: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience. -Knowledge

9436DADD9DCB41FD9A7F282B97CB39B9.description: GOAL 3- Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ

F401D21B48064EE6B09A9396DA81BD3A.description:
Be a witness to the nourishing power of the Eucharist by reaching
out to serve others in the family, in the community and in the world

5BB7CDD63DB8422AAF243997762C74B5.description:
Participate in an active and in a conscious manner in the Eucharist
(Sunday Mass).

F48449ED11A74BDAA6687DB52EABE687.description: Standard C: Appreciate the Eucharist and understand that it is central to our lives and the life of the Catholic Church. -Life Application

4DF82CE7BBEF40C28C97C423B9C5078C.description:
Illustrate an understanding of the Eucharist using drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

56A3270731EC41E8ABAC3F39466DDAB6.description: Reflect and express their appreciation of the Eucharist.

12CEEF8ADE2F4E8EA58EFF733A12F4EC.description:
Discuss how their active participation in the liturgy helps build
up the Body of Christ.

B5511920B3DE40C297A92B48E05A5907.description: Standard C: Appreciate the Eucharist and understand that it is central to our lives and the life of the Catholic Church. -Skill

AF2B949A179D4B038626440D6F2F5893.description:
Know the proper etiquette and appropriate disposition for
receiving Eucharist.

6652208EB1D341FF910487EEEACEBCD4.description:
Be familiar with the Biblical and with the historical origins of
the celebration of the Eucharist in the Church.

9F6E33CE999B44CA912F377A5D6FA28B.description:
Understand that the Eucharist is given to build up the Body of
Christ, the Church.

DF948C4E7D264F2FBC9B984527067878.description:
Know and believe that through the power of the Holy Spirit, the
bread and wine are transformed into the Body and Blood of
Jesus, and that Jesus is truly present.

53AD00AA9FF24772AA4C5AF10A5B8A9E.description: Know that the Church teaches that the Eucharist is a

4EF54D395BBF45F28C6177C73970B713.description:
Know that Eucharist is the memorial and making present of
Christ’s Passover, the work of salvation accomplished by the
life, death and resurrection of Christ.

4C99A323C963430E8F774D651DFD6BFF.description:
Understand the centrality of the Eucharist (Mass) to the life of
the Church.

E323D49FCC5D43D9A9EE74B6E4ED1D7A.description: Standard C: Appreciate the Eucharist and understand that it is central to our lives and the life of the Catholic Church. -Knowledge

95B5DE1802B14F188AF94355400828ED.description: Goal 2- Spread the Gospel message by joyfully sharing our faith and our practices with others.

5FC33DAF17F340EBACD0CE8DDBF852EE.description:
Experience the call to discipleship and imitate Christ so that others
may see Christ in their actions.

38997909157B414F8B82399B1497AAC0.description:
Share stories about family member’s experiences of the
sacraments and what it means for them as an individual.

F4B3AAFAE47345B19BCF2F889230ED3E.description: Participate in the celebration of the sacraments.

265036BD03914A45A96922DE2D2BC68B.description: Standard B: Comprehend that sacraments are an outward sign of God’s Love having the power to transform our lives. -Life Application

0638A804F9CB4850B11E2C914B094A2E.description:
Illustrate an understanding of how God’s love is shown
through the seven sacraments, especially Confirmation using
drama, art, music, technology etc.

C0237D60EBC3449DB0AE022F0B8DB66F.description:
Reflect on their experience of the sacrament celebrations and
express these experiences using their senses.

79653A39FF7D47078C62B81E26045AC8.description:
Research and examine the lives of people who have
experienced how the power of the sacraments have
transformed their lives.

79AAAA8C24D34434BBE4ADC3BACCE4E9.description:
Explain why Catholics celebrate the sacraments and illustrate
how each sacrament is a sign of God’s living presence.

852EECFA80BA470997725DBE793F31EC.description:
Explain the ritual action and the proper minister(s) for each
sacrament.

E0864114A821466FB74311DB2691DB2F.description: Standard B: Comprehend that sacraments are an outward sign of God’s Love having the power to transform our lives. -Skill

BBEC62D5125E4862BC26159587E5AE7F.description: Understand that Confirmation completes Christian initiation.

C35B047A41224EA19954C9BF8D40C616.description:
Recognize that in Confirmation the Holy Spirit helps us to
bear witness to our faith.

6167016B75B0473499C35C6BF996D46B.description:
Recognize that in Confirmation the Holy Spirit brings us into
a deeper relationship with Christ, with the Church, and with
the mission of the Church.

F498D035E2C24910A509A4659DC395B6.description:
Recognize that the sacraments celebrate the presence of
God’s grace in our lives.

64F022B412E04B359EBB784544F987C9.description:
Know the Biblical origin and spiritual significance of the
seven sacraments.

42AFF37B0A084D8C9C536482444C8999.description: Proper disposition for receiving the seven sacraments.

E8688D94497245CF92E78B57CACF9A9E.description: Proper ministers of the seven sacraments.

C97E3379FAE0492190D7A54880F4D7CB.description: Definitions, signs, and symbols of the seven sacraments.

BEED3664301143F0B81BF689A781750E.description: Standard B: Comprehend that sacraments are an outward sign of God’s Love having the power to transform our lives. -Knowledge

0949DC4EB16147BBA66DA5B80DF4C507.description: Goal 2- Spread the Gospel message by joyfully sharing our faith and our practices with others.

AF1D271589B941BFB9984E2407C95FBC.description:
Continue to demonstrate etiquette and reverence while
actively participating in liturgical celebration.

39CCACE111C64F1A89E77E7329B01C3F.description:
Actively participate with family in weekend liturgy and
begin to assume various liturgical roles.

5596435D059645EEB8F82422329B8323.description: Standard A: Recognize and participate in the Catholic Church’s liturgical life as a means to encounter Christ in its feasts, seasons, symbols, practices, and prayers. -Life Application

EDAF3FD4F11C4C27BFCBC5F4CE564E4E.description: Discuss the format and the use of the Lectionary.

70D8EBB4C40B47BF88E1F17289053836.description:
Connect the rhythm of the liturgical season to their
current life circumstances.

696FB8FE68064FA5A96FAFD39D37432A.description:
Continue to demonstrate etiquette and reverence while
actively participating in liturgical celebration.

A4CE6C2B53CA4F47BF6DFB0C13F04ACF.description:
Participate in various liturgical roles, including the
Assembly.

4793D75A2D7547E5BC9BB4B27E32763C.description:
Identify and experience appropriate and meaningful
symbols of the liturgical seasons.

56AD9CE01D1A475BB64188A31E7DAB9B.description: Standard A: Recognize and participate in the Catholic Church’s liturgical life as a means to encounter Christ in its feasts, seasons, symbols, practices, and prayers. -Skill

660530C809CB4EF7AEF3303BAC836E59.description:
Recognize the proper vocabulary for liturgical
worship, i.e. space, vessels, vestments, etc.

5E83FACDA2E34A90A58FB75741123232.description:
Learn proper terminology for all parts of the Mass,
e.g. Greeting, Gloria, Gospel Acclamation, etc.

6699932BBA554DFF942EA1E01BCCB125.description:
Understand different parts of the Mass: Liturgy of
Word and Liturgy of Eucharist.

7E962D8243AA43A99194542A0B105735.description:
Know that Sunday is the principal day for celebration
of Eucharist.

0A1E04A067694BD28F04558D0FA52F8B.description:
Understand the liturgical year and the cultural
traditions that are celebrated.

A1C627BC15D84E79AD91AAE1EDC9B33D.description:
Understand the cycle of the liturgical year and its
sources in the life of Jesus in the Bible.

CB53E30CD85D4BE7A453DE69A8332FFE.description: Standard A: Recognize and participate in the Catholic Church’s liturgical life as a means to encounter Christ in its feasts, seasons, symbols, practices, and prayers. -Knowledge

7C9F003F8A464915A31732EE64D09977.description:
Goal 2- Spread the Gospel message by joyfully sharing our faith
and our practices with others.

ECD031E2FAA648B3A87B1EFBEB8AADBF.description:
Spread the Gospel message by joyfully sharing our faith
and our practices with others.

2C3AC915222240EBBEC87BEB76B5E3D0.description: Standard D: Understand the origin and Tradition of the Catholic Church and its mission to spread the Gospel message. -Life Application

6A7F3D510F324B639B5A0B19C431830D.description:
Illustrate the origin, Tradition and mission of the Church
using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

C686BDF99ABA472BB38F0A6086C5124D.description: Relate their lives to Catholic teachings.

201C7489EF5A4CC5BB15F8DB61028A4D.description: Describe the development of the early Church.

8972DEA2BDC54626BC953CF27966194A.description:
Explain the Tradition of the Church as celebrated in
liturgical seasons: waiting, rejoicing, repenting,
celebrating and growing.

D20E7892885D4F20815119CE5586A453.description: Standard D: Understand the origin and Tradition of the Catholic Church and its mission to spread the Gospel message. -Skill

3DD9C53C0EA541A4B6318C2C664CB9EA.description:
Know the current structure and governance of the
Church and the responsibilities of all baptized.

046F78ED5E894734AB6786A90ABB8F74.description:
Understand the relationship of the early Church to
Scripture.

A4AE10E6A3F64BFEAD4EEEB29FEAB56B.description:
Know that all we believe, “Deposit of Faith” is
contained in Scripture and Tradition, and is the source of
current Church teaching (CCC 84).

B5B07E835F9441DEAF51B2D6670BFDBC.description:
Know that Tradition comes from the apostles who
handed on what they received from Jesus and what they
learned from the Holy Spirit (CCC 83).

93D12084D9964083A2D9485893821B32.description:
Be familiar with the origin of the Church as told in the
Acts of the Apostles.

8AB7A12B327140738DD7DF1CCFCD9B4B.description: Standard D: Understand the origin and Tradition of the Catholic Church and its mission to spread the Gospel message. -Knowledge

A9248DE1AFB546E197DB5853049B1E14.description: GOAL 1- Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church.

436E4C7C33854F16882ECD3C73726080.description:
Celebrate the special days honoring Mary and the saints
with family.

44EBC1BE0C944C64BC371766340E50C5.description:
Continue to develop devotion to Mary and to the saints in
their personal prayer life.

57F3FC88F5A34FB68414905DDFA78423.description:
Apply the knowledge and the example of the life of Mary
and the lives of the saints to their daily lives.

779251234073482E9E8DFD648904F0EB.description: Standard C: Know and apply the teachings of the Catholic Church as they are reflected in the life of the Virgin Mary, in the Communion of Saints and in the Church. -Life Application

E87AF49E7D3542BFBB144B57BAA8FDE9.description:
Illustrate the lives of Mary and the saints as models of
discipleship using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

5D2C73B67F5C456DBDFCFC5A575423D3.description:
Explain the qualities and virtues of Mary and of the saints
and identify them as role models.

00505990BAF34EB18DE48FB4DC1E440D.description:
Compare the Mary in Scripture to the Mary of the
devotional traditions of the Church (apparitions, etc.).

D7665B85F45D4A50B51A0FBBDD9D4538.description:
Recite specific prayers to Mary that are part of our
Tradition.

2B2A7B7003FA411AB6C96297106A1D7B.description:
Discuss various feasts, prayers and celebrations of Mary as
part of our Tradition.

4136C15C0F624CCCBED2700B9AB10CDA.description: Standard C: Know and apply the teachings of the Catholic Church as they are reflected in the life of the Virgin Mary, in the Communion of Saints and in the Church. -Skill

864075C20C6B4ABDADD6319B4F2D3A3C.description:
Be familiar with the history of the saints in our Church and
our relationship to the communion of saints.

B65D9ED59E8942D497DCE0229F894AE9.description:
Recognize the feasts of Mary, what they celebrate and their
meaning in the Church.

64142F28D75C49B6843599BA124CC178.description:
Know the Church’s teachings about Mary the Mother of
God and appreciate her role in the Church.

ADFDAFA795DB47C3B858D9B6F537CD70.description: Standard C: Know and apply the teachings of the Catholic Church as they are reflected in the life of the Virgin Mary, in the Communion of Saints and in the Church. -Knowledge

F597685DE39A48D8822519D44B7991EE.description: GOAL 1- Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church.

EE72E5B3557546B9AC68AB0690F27517.description: Show evidence in their life of being a disciple of Jesus.

C79842E46F82424F9E69874211803232.description:
Be able to talk about the Liturgy of the Word with family
and with friends.

13774D619434443EA4DF0FB759A457E9.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture. -Life Application

F97BEFF37E2F4C3694070A23CE6F3255.description:
Use research to further their study of the Old and New
Testaments.

7198FA374AEA491CA5812C4C9CEE22FD.description:
Illustrate Bible Stories through drama, art, music,
technology, etc.

8995A1D2BA0B4A96AE9187D57037874C.description:
Compare how the life of Jesus is portrayed in each of the
four Gospels.

D1E949E37F7A40DF9B022C291526662C.description:
Read one of the four Gospels in its entirety (beginning to
end) according to the Cycle of Readings (A, B, or C).

D6DB7B27BDD94ACF9C5452F1669A7D88.description:
Locate the life of Jesus as fulfillment of salvation history in
relationship to the Old Testament (Jewish Scripture).

A227B14E063946A79BE352FBEAB7E10C.description:
Identify and discuss the values or virtues expressed in
specific Scripture Stories.

93C0756ADF094A67B22F1E006D42B1CF.description: Read, study & discuss Old and New Testaments.

9DA180E31466453DBF44BB448161EC58.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture. -Skill

BFFCDA0B19EB47DCB805D05C430069BA.description:
Recognize mysteries of the Rosary as a compendium of the
life of Christ.

03C79BF5AAF34CC1AA316DEE42E08322.description:
Understand the relevance of the Gospel as a whole to
Christian Life.

7E8F646AA35E4F8995F26A6822542414.description:
Know that the life of Jesus is the fulfillment of salvation
history as foretold in the Old Testament (Jewish Scripture).

9550CD14E1974929998C9DAA0B2AA052.description:
Identify Jesus’ life and teachings as portrayed in Sacred
Scripture.

E3BCAEE33C094B608F86D15A3C06861F.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture. -Knowledge

5F9F886D2D824FF3A735FBB4F54986DF.description: GOAL 1- Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church.

C973B7273D6D43C3AF68B68CEA76CFD2.description: Give witness to their Catholic beliefs in their daily lives.

940125D517EB4F1D95601693F6208BE6.description:
Share with family their understanding of God: Father, Son
and Holy Spirit.

BA76DB8B2D854E1D9309A7DA72477D85.description:
Attend Mass with family and pray the Nicene Creed along
with assembly.

B88B1DF0327B4D74BE0CCF48D68282C4.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church. -Life Application

F968CD7EA45A4AC6AFA120E3F1869E9F.description: Illustrate beliefs using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

A4ABE8151F914543A39B68869D62C30D.description:
Tell how the beliefs of the Catholic Church are reflected in
their daily life.

3410DBF9251841749480EE25197C8E9A.description:
Explain how the Marks of the Church are evident in the
world today.

7FF2EF93211F47D4BCBE4DE99F13764A.description: Explain the truths identified in the Apostles’ Creed.

50D7C56DD6F346D7BFF942786F00DF5C.description: Recite the Apostles’ Creed and the Nicene Creed.

DB4B49137FDC4CBBA14BE8ADC853AA35.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church. -Skill

5A60CA652B8F4382BE897E8A05FB7105.description:
Recognize the twelve articles of faith as stated in the
Apostles’ Creed: 1) I believe in God the Father Almighty,
Creator of Heaven and earth, 2) I believe in Jesus Christ, His
only Son, 3) He was conceived by the Holy Spirit, and born of
the Virgin Mary 4) Jesus Christ suffered under Pontius Pilate,
was crucified, died, and buried, 5) He descended into hell and
on the third day He rose 6) He ascended into Heaven and is
seated at the right hand of the Father 7) He will come again to
judge the living and the dead 8) I believe in the Holy Spirit, 9)
the Holy Catholic Church 10) the forgiveness of sins, 11) the
resurrection of the Body, 12) and in life everlasting.

6F13368B9B13450E855AB63913440E8E.description:
Recognize the Marks of the Church as one, holy, catholic
and apostolic.

2F69202653874B10A1513DEC4C621230.description:
Understand the historical origin of the two Creeds from
Scripture and from Tradition.

C7EF9D8B7C5E4EA6A19B52E5FF01FD2E.description:
Recognize that the key points of both Creeds (Apostles’
Creed and Nicene Creed) are Trinitarian – one God, Father,
Son, and Holy Spirit.

3BC8B887F064463D9732DF68D6C2F602.description:
Know that God’s very being is truth and is love: all
present, all knowing and eternal.

9436071EB38E44228568AD5A2F0F025C.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church. -Knowledge

6CA887BAA1F946B99DA48E036178EA53.description: GOAL 1- Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church.
